intro: Cybianthus cenepensis, commonly known as the yellow balm of Gilead, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. Cybianthus cenepensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
